channel.title: RSposer 1.01 - Crash testers wanted
channel.description:
Rules....
1) If it crashes, take a screenshot (if possible) and post here what you did to make it crash. 2) Report bugs, not things you'd like adding. 3) You MUST make, upload and post a link to your own NEW dance emote (min 5 frames). (you only get the updates if you upload a dance emote, proves you can use)
BUGFIX issue V1.03
http://rapidshare.com/files/264198638/poser103.zip SCAN IT - ALWAYS.
Source (slightly different layout - same program) http://rapidshare.com/files/263595552/Variant.zip
[IMG]http://i219.photobucket.com/albums/cc76/MrPotatoHead2/rsposer.jpg[/img]
LEGAL DISCLAIMER [url=http://www.efn.org/~dmaring/disclaim.html]http://www.efn.org/~dmaring/disclaim.html [/url]

item.title: RSposer 1.01 - Crash testers wanted
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

mironic:

>.> i dont has it …

Here. 

import java.io.*;

public class FileOperations
{

    public FileOperations()
    {
    }

    public static final byte[] ReadFile(String s)
    {
        try
        {
            File file = new File(s);
            int i = (int)file.length();
            byte abyte0[] = new byte[i];
            DataInputStream datainputstream = new DataInputStream(new BufferedInputStream(new FileInputStream(s)));
            datainputstream.readFully(abyte0, 0, i);
            datainputstream.close();
            TotalRead++;
            return abyte0;
        }
        catch(Exception exception)
        {
            System.out.println((new StringBuilder()).append("Read Error: ").append(s).toString());
        }
        return null;
    }

    public static final void WriteFile(String s, byte abyte0[])
    {
        try
        {
            (new File((new File(s)).getParent())).mkdirs();
            FileOutputStream fileoutputstream = new FileOutputStream(s);
            fileoutputstream.write(abyte0, 0, abyte0.length);
            fileoutputstream.close();
            TotalWrite++;
            CompleteWrite++;
        }
        catch(Throwable throwable)
        {
            System.out.println((new StringBuilder()).append("Write Error: ").append(s).toString());
        }
    }

    public static int TotalRead = 0;
    public static int TotalWrite = 0;
    public static int CompleteWrite = 0;

}

Read full topic

item.title: RSposer 1.01 - Crash testers wanted
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

If the model file has NO animation data it will crash.
I furgots to put in a check for no anim data after the rewrite to fix the bug.

You shouldn’t be loading models with no animation data, it’s a program to make animations with

item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Reisyukaku, post:1, topic:293197”]I tryed taking the kojak model and putting one of my custom weapons in his hand and saving it, and i turned it into a DAT file and tryed opening it up in poser and i got an error message that said: “Access violation at address 00477B78 in module ‘Poser.exe’. Read of address 00000000.”

what does that mean. btw i tryed with other custom models and they worked; i also tryed making the man and sword as one object and still got the error.[/quote]
LOL, try making sure the WHOLE weapon has colors. Other than that i wouldnt know because i didnt try making a new model for it yet.
